SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver
Class SwiftSocketServer

java.lang.Object
  org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.SwiftSocketServer

public class SwiftSocketServer
extends Object

A low level message server that mediates messages from and to clients and the server in the form of 'datagrams' (custom serialized messages identified by a unique signature). See ClientMessageToServer for further details on these messages.

This class manages some server basics such as the server Socket, ServerType to create the server endpoint with, the port on which this server listens and the server state (stopped, stopping, running) as well as a maintaining a flag that indicated the use of ping / pong mode. This class also contains the lists of message types mapped to the unique identifiers known to both the clients and server.

Furthermore, this class receives new client connections and assigns ClientHandler instances (see clientHandlers). The client handlers offer executable messages from clients back for the server to queue them and execute them sequentially (see clientMessages).

This server embodies the client listening function regardless of the type of server (UDP / TCP) in a uniform way. The differences between UDP and TCP are managed by the serverType. Everything that this server is used for can be done with either TCP or UDP without the user having to change anything. Just provide the right ServerType and the server changes without breaking API.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Benny Bottema

Constant Field Values

port

private final int port

serverType

private final ServerType serverType
The ServerType used to create the TCP/UDP ServerEndpoint with.

serverEndpoint

private ServerEndpoint serverEndpoint
the server endpoint takes care of sending message to clients and receiving incoming client sockets. Created when starting the server as a TCP or UDP endpoint.

See Also:
ServerEndpoint

clientMessageToServerTypeList

private final Map<Integer,Class<? extends ClientMessageToServer<?>>> clientMessageToServerTypeList
Used to identify a ClientMessageToServer type that can handle a binary packet.

executionContexts

private final Map<Class<? extends ClientMessageToServer<?>>,Object> executionContexts
Contains context objects mapped directly against a executable client message type. Usage of this list is optional.

This mechanism automates executing messages using a pre-registered context object. Client messages that are registered in this list will not be queued in the clientMessages queue for manual processing.

serverMessageToClientIdList

private final Map<Class<? extends ServerMessageToClient>,Integer> serverMessageToClientIdList
Used to prepend the right binary packet code for a given ServerMessageToClient type.

clientMessages

private final LinkedList<ClientMessageToServer<?>> clientMessages
A queue that contains unprocessed messages from any client.

clientHandlers

private final Map<ClientContext,ClientHandler> clientHandlers
A list of simultaneous client connection handlers, for receiving ClientMessageToServer messages and sending ServerMessageToClient messages.

stopping

private boolean stopping
Indicates whether stop() has been called and the server socket has been closed.

pingPongMode

private boolean pingPongMode
Default turned off in the constructor.

pingPongIntervalMs

private int pingPongIntervalMs
Interval in milliseconds for ping messages to the client. Default set to 2500ms in the constructor.

pingPongTimeoutMs

private int pingPongTimeoutMs
Timeout in milliseconds for a pong message to the client. Default set to 5000ms in the constructor.

Constructor Detail

SwiftSocketServer

public SwiftSocketServer(int port)
Default constructor, calls SwiftSocketServer(int, ServerType) with TCP ServerType.

Parameters:
port - The port on which to start listening.

SwiftSocketServer

public SwiftSocketServer(int port,
                         ServerType serverType)
Creates a swift socket server and registers a couple of basic message types (message invalid, 'Ping Pong' and 'Bye Bye'). Also sets default Ping Pong interval and timeout. The Ping Pong mode is turned off by default.
  • Message invalid: sent to the client when a message code was not recognized
  • Ping message: sent when setPingPongMode(boolean, int, int) feature is turned on
  • ByeBye message: sent as an ACK message when a client is gracefully disconnecting by sending a Bye Bye message

Parameters:
port - The port on which to start listening.
serverType - The ServerType strategy used to communicate.
Method Detail

setPingPongMode

public void setPingPongMode(boolean pingPongMode)
Sets PingPong mode, use to poll clients for time-outs. Clients will need to support this as well. When changed, will only apply the new setting to new clients.

Parameters:
pingPongMode - Flag indicating use of ping pong mode yes/no.

setPingPongMode

public void setPingPongMode(boolean pingPongMode,
                            int pingPongIntervalMs,
                            int pingPongTimeoutMs)
Sets PingPong mode, use to poll clients for time-outs. Clients will need to support this as well. When changed, will only apply the new setting to new clients.

Parameters:
pingPongMode - Flag indicating use of ping pong mode yes/no.
pingPongIntervalMs - Interval in milliseconds for ping messages to the client.
pingPongTimeoutMs - Timeout in milliseconds for a pong message to the client.

registerClientMessageToServerType

public void registerClientMessageToServerType(int messageId,
                                              Class<? extends ClientMessageToServer<?>> messageType)
Registers a client-to-server message on the given unique identifier. Both the client and server must use the same identifier to be able to decode the message on the server.

Parameters:
messageId - The unique identifier for this message type.
messageType - A ClientMessageToServer sub type.

registerServerMessageToClientId

public void registerServerMessageToClientId(int messageId,
                                            Class<? extends ServerMessageToClient> messageType)
Registers a server-to-client message on the given unique identifier. Both the client and server must use the same identifier to be able to decode the message on the client.

Parameters:
messageId - The unique identifier for this message type.
messageType - A ServerMessageToClient sub type.

registerExecutionContext

public void registerExecutionContext(Class<? extends ClientMessageToServer<?>> messageType,
                                     Object executionContext)
Registers a default execution context for a client-to-server message type. Incoming messages of the given type are not queued in clientMessages, but executed directly using the registered execution context. This way the user doesn't have to manually process these executable client messages.

Parameters:
messageType - The type of message that will be matched and executed using the given context object.
executionContext - The execution context object used to execute executable client messages against.

start

public void start()
Thread safe method that starts the client thread, listening for new messages and sending messages.

See Also:
SwiftSocketServer.InvisibleServerRunner

hasClientMessages

public boolean hasClientMessages()
Returns:
Whether there are unprocessed client messages waiting in queue to be executed.

getNextClientMessage

public ClientMessageToServer<?> getNextClientMessage()
Returns:
The next queues unprocessed client messages to be executed (see LinkedList.poll()).

disposeOfClient

Removes a ClientContext and associated ClientHandler from the list of known clients.

Parameters:
client - The client we need to purge along with its connection handler.

handleMessages

private void handleMessages(ServerEndpoint serverEndpoint)
                     throws IOException
Listens for new clients on the server endpoint. Creates a new ClientHandler for each new ClientEndpoint.

Parameters:
serverEndpoint - The server endpoint on which we expect client messages.
Throws:
IOException - Thrown by ServerEndpoint.getClientEndpoint().

Parameters:
message - The message to send to the client associated with it.

addClientMessage

Adds a message to the queue for later processing, unless a known context object has been registered for this object in executionContexts.

Parameters:

getClientMessageToServerType

protected Class<? extends ClientMessageToServer<?>> getClientMessageToServerType(int messageId)
Parameters:
messageId - The message id for which to find the registered message type.
Returns:
The client-to-server message type associated with the given message id, or ClientMessageToServerInvalid if not found.

getServerMessageId

Parameters:

The unique identifier registered for the given message type.

getAllClientContexts

public Collection<ClientContext> getAllClientContexts()
Returns:
All client contexts currently known. These clients are not necessarily active.

stop

public void stop()
Thread safe method to make the server initialize stopping procedure. This means setting a flag and letting client handlers manage disconnecting the clients, while closing the server socket simultaneously.

shutdown

private void shutdown()

isRunning

public boolean isRunning()
Returns:
Whether the server is not stopping.
